verses.text_plain: But now they that are younger than I have me in derision, whose fathers I would have disdained to have set with the dogs of my flock.
verses.verse_html:
1But now they that are younger than I have me in derision, whose fathers I would have disdained to have set with the dogs of my flock. ▼
▼ younger…: Heb. of fewer days than I

tokens.text: than I have me in derision

footnotes.body_text: ▼ younger…: Heb. of fewer days than I
footnotes.body_html: ▼ younger…: Heb. of fewer days than I

verses.text_plain: Yea, whereto might the strength of their hands profit me, in whom old age was perished?
verses.verse_html: 2Yea, whereto might the strength of their hands profit me, in whom old age was perished?

verses.text_plain: For want and famine they were solitary; fleeing into the wilderness in former time desolate and waste.
verses.verse_html:
3For want and famine they were solitary; fleeing into the wilderness in former time desolate and waste. ▼
▼ solitary: or, dark as the night
 , ▼
▼ in…: Heb. yesternight

footnotes.body_text: ▼ solitary: or, dark as the night
footnotes.body_html: ▼ solitary: or, dark as the night

verses.text_plain: Who cut up mallows by the bushes, and juniper roots for their meat.
verses.verse_html: 4Who cut up mallows by the bushes, and juniper roots for their meat.

verses.text_plain: They were driven forth from among men, (they cried after them as after a thief;)
verses.verse_html: 5They were driven forth from among men, (they cried after them as after a thief;)

verses.text_plain: To dwell in the clifts of the valleys, in caves of the earth, and in the rocks.
verses.verse_html:
6To dwell in the clifts of the valleys, in caves of the earth, and in the rocks. ▼
▼ caves: Heb. holes

verses.text_plain: Among the bushes they brayed; under the nettles they were gathered together.
verses.verse_html: 7Among the bushes they brayed; under the nettles they were gathered together.

verses.text_plain: They were children of fools, yea, children of base men: they were viler than the earth.
verses.verse_html:
8They were children of fools, yea, children of base men: they were viler than the earth. ▼
▼ base…: Heb. men of no name

footnotes.body_text: ▼ base…: Heb. men of no name
footnotes.body_html: ▼ base…: Heb. men of no name

verses.text_plain: And now am I their song, yea, I am their byword.
verses.verse_html: 9And now am I their song, yea, I am their byword.

tokens.text: And now am I their song

verses.text_plain: They abhor me, they flee far from me, and spare not to spit in my face.
verses.verse_html:
10They abhor me, they flee far from me, and spare not to spit in my face. ▼
▼ and…: Heb. and withhold not spittle from

footnotes.body_text: ▼ and…: Heb. and withhold not spittle from
footnotes.body_html: ▼ and…: Heb. and withhold not spittle from

verses.text_plain: Because he hath loosed my cord, and afflicted me, they have also let loose the bridle before me.
verses.verse_html: 11Because he hath loosed my cord, and afflicted me, they have also let loose the bridle before me.

tokens.text: me, they have also let loose

verses.text_plain: Upon my right hand rise the youth; they push away my feet, and they raise up against me the ways of their destruction.
verses.verse_html: 12Upon my right hand rise the youth; they push away my feet, and they raise up against me the ways of their destruction.

verses.text_plain: They mar my path, they set forward my calamity, they have no helper.
verses.verse_html: 13They mar my path, they set forward my calamity, they have no helper.

verses.text_plain: They came upon me as a wide breaking in of waters: in the desolation they rolled themselves upon me.
verses.verse_html: 14They came upon me as a wide breaking in of waters: in the desolation they rolled themselves upon me.

verses.text_plain: Terrors are turned upon me: they pursue my soul as the wind: and my welfare passeth away as a cloud.
verses.verse_html:
15Terrors are turned upon me: they pursue my soul as the wind: and my welfare passeth away as a cloud. ▼
▼ my soul: Heb. my principal one

footnotes.body_text: ▼ my soul: Heb. my principal one
footnotes.body_html: ▼ my soul: Heb. my principal one

verses.text_plain: And now my soul is poured out upon me; the days of affliction have taken hold upon me.
verses.verse_html: 16And now my soul is poured out upon me; the days of affliction have taken hold upon me.

verses.text_plain: My bones are pierced in me in the night season: and my sinews take no rest.
verses.verse_html: 17My bones are pierced in me in the night season: and my sinews take no rest.

tokens.text: in me in the night season

verses.text_plain: By the great force of my disease is my garment changed: it bindeth me about as the collar of my coat.
verses.verse_html: 18By the great force of my disease is my garment changed: it bindeth me about as the collar of my coat.

verses.text_plain: He hath cast me into the mire, and I am become like dust and ashes.
verses.verse_html: 19He hath cast me into the mire, and I am become like dust and ashes.

verses.text_plain: I cry unto thee, and thou dost not hear me: I stand up, and thou regardest me not.
verses.verse_html: 20I cry unto thee, and thou dost not hear me: I stand up, and thou regardest me not.

tokens.text: unto thee, and thou dost not hear

verses.text_plain: Thou art become cruel to me: with thy strong hand thou opposest thyself against me.
verses.verse_html:
21Thou art become cruel to me: with thy strong hand thou opposest thyself against me. ▼
▼ become…: Heb. turned to be cruel
 , ▼
▼ thy…: Heb. the strength of thy hand

footnotes.body_text: ▼ become…: Heb. turned to be cruel
footnotes.body_html: ▼ become…: Heb. turned to be cruel

footnotes.body_text: ▼ thy…: Heb. the strength of thy hand
footnotes.body_html: ▼ thy…: Heb. the strength of thy hand

verses.text_plain: Thou liftest me up to the wind; thou causest me to ride upon it, and dissolvest my substance.
verses.verse_html:
22Thou liftest me up to the wind; thou causest me to ride upon it, and dissolvest my substance. ▼
▼ substance: or, wisdom

verses.text_plain: For I know that thou wilt bring me to death, and to the house appointed for all living.
verses.verse_html: 23For I know that thou wilt bring me to death, and to the house appointed for all living.

verses.text_plain: Howbeit he will not stretch out his hand to the grave, though they cry in his destruction.
verses.verse_html:
24Howbeit he will not stretch out his hand to the grave, though they cry in his destruction. ▼
▼ grave: Heb. heap

tokens.text: Howbeit he will not stretch out

verses.text_plain: Did not I weep for him that was in trouble? was not my soul grieved for the poor?
verses.verse_html:
25Did not I weep for him that was in trouble? was not my soul grieved for the poor? ▼
▼ in trouble: Heb. hard of day?

tokens.text: for him that was in trouble

footnotes.body_text: ▼ in trouble: Heb. hard of day?
footnotes.body_html: ▼ in trouble: Heb. hard of day?

verses.text_plain: When I looked for good, then evil came unto me: and when I waited for light, there came darkness.
verses.verse_html: 26When I looked for good, then evil came unto me: and when I waited for light, there came darkness.

verses.text_plain: My bowels boiled, and rested not: the days of affliction prevented me.
verses.verse_html: 27My bowels boiled, and rested not: the days of affliction prevented me.

verses.text_plain: I went mourning without the sun: I stood up, and I cried in the congregation.
verses.verse_html: 28I went mourning without the sun: I stood up, and I cried in the congregation.

verses.text_plain: I am a brother to dragons, and a companion to owls.
verses.verse_html:
29I am a brother to dragons, and a companion to owls. ▼
▼ owls: or, ostriches

verses.text_plain: My skin is black upon me, and my bones are burned with heat.
verses.verse_html: 30My skin is black upon me, and my bones are burned with heat.

verses.text_plain: My harp also is turned to mourning, and my organ into the voice of them that weep.
verses.verse_html: 31My harp also is turned to mourning, and my organ into the voice of them that weep.
